assessmentPlan.assessmentPlanBuilder.ins: Your first step is to pick some assessments that will allow you to evaluate the criteria you've selected for your job poster. Below you'll find your essential criteria, followed by your asset criteria if you've selected any. The builder will save as you go, so when you're finished, feel free to move to step 2 to review your work.
assessmentPlan.assetCriteria.nullState: You have no asset skills selected for this job poster.
assessmentPlan.essentialCriteria.nullSta: You have no essential skills selected for this job poster.
assessmentPlan.instructions.intro: This tool allows you to build an assessment plan and a ratings guide for your job poster. The tool is used in 3 steps:
assessmentPlan.instructions.narrativeNot: Please note that all assessment plans will include a review of the narrative evidence provided by the applicant.
assessmentPlan.ratingGuideBuilder.title: Ratings Guide Builder
assessmentPlan.selectAssessment.label: Select an Assessment
assessmentPlan.summary.assessmentSummary:
You have no assessments selected for this job poster. Add them
              above.

Your plan uses {toolCount, plural, =0 {no tools} one {# tool} other {# tools}}
            to assess {skillCount, plural, =0 {no skills} one {# skill} other {# skills}}.
assessmentPlan.summary.description:
This is a summary of the work you've done above. You'll find
      each assessment accompanied by a consolidated list of the essential and
      asset skills attached to it.
assessmentPlan.summary.skillCount: Assessing {count, plural, one {# skill} other {# skills}}.
assessmentPlan.summary.skillsNullState: No skills being assessed by this tool.
assessmentPlan.summary.title: 2. Assessment Plan Summary
assessmentType.applicationScreeningQuest: These questions appear in the application form, and are submitted through Talent Cloud, they allow a first glance at the applicant’s understanding, process, knowledge, or cultural fit for the position.
assessmentType.groupTest.description: Applicants perform this test in real-time in conjunction with other applicants, team members, or facilitators, to determine their skill prowess, team communication, and performance in a collaborative environment.
assessmentType.informalPhoneConversation: A loose structure chat between a member of the hiring board and an applicant, aimed at discovering the applicant’s knowledge, aptitudes, or personality traits, conversations may vary between applicants.
assessmentType.interview.description: A formal question-and-answer examination performed in real-time between the hiring-board and an applicant, questions are aimed at assessing skill expertise, level, and approach. Each question is crafted beforehand and follows the same structure between all interviewed applicants.
assessmentType.narrativeAssessment.descr: This is a description requested during the application process, in which applicants to self-identify and describe their experience and level of expertise with a skill.
assessmentType.narrativeReview.standardA: The provided description contains sufficient evidence to advance this candidate to the next screening steps.
assessmentType.narrativeReview.standardQ: Narrative Review of skill includes all descriptions added by the applicant in their application.
assessmentType.onSiteExam.description: Prepared examination that requires the applicant to perform a test at a specific location under supervision, aimed at assessing skill expertise and technique.
assessmentType.onlineExam.description: Prepared examination that does not require supervision, and can be performed from any location through internet access, with a defined time-frame for completion.
assessmentType.portfolioReview.descripti: During the application process, applicants provide access to samples of their work to exhibit their skill level, and back-up their skill claims.
assessmentType.referenceCheck.descriptio: During the application process, applicants provide contact information to an acquaintance who can validate and confirm their skill expertise, knowledge or aptitude.
assessmentType.seriousGames.description: Test involving the use of games to explore a candidate’s communication skills, resilience, emotional intelligence, among many other soft skills.
assessmentType.takeHomeExam.description: Applicants receive a physical package containing the assessment tools, they complete the assessment at their own leisure and at their preferred location without supervision, and must return the materials before a specific deadline.
button.toggleAccordion: Basculer pour voir les candidats concernés.
department.innovationScience: Innovation, Science and Economic Development Canada
errorToast.title: Something went wrong!
formValidation.checkboxRequired: At least one checkbox is required.
formValidation.invalidSelection: Please select from the available options.
job.daysSinceClosed: {dayCount, plural, =0 {Aucun jour} one {# jour} other {# jours}} depuis la fermeture
jobBuilder.culturePace.01.description: Our deadlines are tight, we balance several tasks at the same time, and our priorities are always changing. Our work should come with running shoes!
jobBuilder.culturePace.01.title: Very Fast-paced
jobBuilder.culturePace.02.description: Our deadlines are usually close together, we balance some tasks at the same time, and our priorities change regularly. Our work keeps us on our toes!
jobBuilder.culturePace.02.title: Fast-paced
jobBuilder.culturePace.03.description: Our deadlines are regular and predictable, we balance a couple of tasks at a time, and our priorities change occasionally. We keep things on an even keel.
jobBuilder.culturePace.03.title: Steady
jobBuilder.culturePace.04.description: Our work is ongoing so there aren't very many deadlines. We don't usually have to balance tasks and our priorities change rarely. We thrive on routine.
jobBuilder.culturePace.04.title: Very Steady
jobBuilder.experimental.01.description: Our work is defined by trying out brand new ideas, methods, and activities to address persistent problems that traditional approaches have failed to solve.
jobBuilder.experimental.01.title: Experimental
jobBuilder.experimental.02.description: We try out new and proven ideas, methods, and activities to improve how we do our work.
jobBuilder.experimental.02.title: Somewhat Experimental
jobBuilder.experimental.03.description: Our work includes some administrative tasks are repeated on a regular basis. The tools we use work well for us but we are open to improving our processes.
jobBuilder.experimental.03.title: Somewhat Predictable Work
jobBuilder.experimental.04.description: Most of our work involves administrative tasks are repeated on a regular basis. Consistency is key here, so we follow a standard process with tried and true tools.
jobBuilder.experimental.04.title: Predictable Work
jobBuilder.impact.header.department: Comment votre ministère engendre des impacts:
jobBuilder.impact.hireBody: Décrivez la contribution du nouvel employé dans son rôle. Concentrez-vous sur la valeur qu’il apportera et non des tâches particulières (vous les indiquerez plus loin). Par exemple « Dans ce rôle, vous contribuerez à … » ou « En tant que membre de l’équipe, vous serez responsable de nous aider à… »
jobBuilder.impact.hireHeader: Comment le nouvel employé engendra des impacts
jobBuilder.impact.hirePlaceholder: Souvenez-vous de ne pas utiliser de jargon administratif.
jobBuilder.impact.points.counts: La première chose que les candidats voient lorsqu’ils cliquent sur votre avis de concours est votre énoncé des impacts. Assurez-vous donc de bien le rédiger!
jobBuilder.impact.points.highlight: C’est votre chance de souligner en quoi votre travail est utile et intéressant.
jobBuilder.impact.points.opportunity: Travailler pour le gouvernement fédéral offre une importante occasion d’engendrer des impacts majeures pour les Canadiens.
jobBuilder.impact.selectDepartment: You must select a Department for this Job.
jobBuilder.impact.teamBody: Décrivez la valeur apportée aux Canadiens par votre équipe/service/initiative. Peu importe si votre travail consiste à offrir des services directs aux citoyens ou des services administratifs, d’innovation ou d’entretien, de priorité absolue ou continus. Décrivez comment votre travail contribue à améliorer le Canada comme si vous parliez à quelqu’un qui ne connait rien à propos de votre travail.
jobBuilder.impact.teamHeader: Comment votre équipe engendre des impacts:
jobBuilder.impact.teamPlaceholder: Employez un ton informel, franc et amical
jobBuilder.impact.title: Rédiger votre énoncé des impacts
jobBuilder.intro.beforeWeStart: FR Before we get started please review your information.
jobBuilder.intro.completeInLanguage:
Complete the job poster in the language of your choice. We will
                  handle translation.
jobBuilder.intro.note: Note: Changing your information on this form will also change these fields in your Profile.
jobBuilder.intro.subtitle01: FR This tool will help you create a job poster that attracts the right talent.
jobBuilder.intro.subtitle02: FR We’ve also provided instructions and examples to help guide you through the process but if you still have questions, contact
jobBuilder.intro.welcome: Bienvenue sur le Job Poster Builder
jobBuilder.mgmtStyle.01.description: There’s no middle management here, so we make most big decisions ourselves and you can expect to interact regularly with our executives.
jobBuilder.mgmtStyle.01.title: Horizontal
jobBuilder.mgmtStyle.02.description: We have some middle management here but make most day-to-day decisions ourselves. Don’t be surprised to interact fairly often with our executives.
jobBuilder.mgmtStyle.02.title: Somewhat Horizontal
jobBuilder.mgmtStyle.03.description: Our team has a clearly defined role. We check in regularly with middle-management for approvals and updates on the strategic vision of our executives.
jobBuilder.mgmtStyle.03.title: Somewhat Vertical
jobBuilder.mgmtStyle.04.description: Our team has a clearly defined role. We check in often with middle-management for approvals and updates on the strategic vision of our executives.
jobBuilder.mgmtStyle.04.title: Vertical
jobBuilder.workEnv.cultureSubtext1: Now let applicants know more about the personality of your team and the type of work that you usually do.
jobBuilder.workEnv.cultureSubtext2: Based on your selections, we’ll create a short paragraph summarizing your work culture. You can edit this paragraph to customize it to your team.
jobBuilder.workEnv.cultureSummarySubtext: Here is the short paragraph summarizing your work culture which will appear on the job poster. Copy and paste it into the text box below if you want to customize it to the personality of your team and the way you work.
jobBuilder.workEnv.customCultureSummaryP: Paste here to edit the paragraph.
jobBuilder.workEnv.greatStart: You're off to a great start!
jobBuilder.workEnv.moreOnWorkEnvPlacehol: Try for a casual, frank, friendly tone.
jobBuilder.workEnv.moreOnWorkEnvSubtext: Anything else you’d like to add about your work environment? Highlight features of the physical environment, technology and amenities specific to your team.
jobBuilder.workEnv.openingSentence:
Here's a preview of the Job Information you just entered. Feel
                free to go back and edit things or move to the next step if
                you're happy with it.
jobBuilder.workEnv.ourWorkEnvDesc: Share a little about your physical space, the technology used by your team, and the amenities close to your office. Check all that apply.
jobBuilder.workEnv.specialWorkCulture: Anything Special About Your Work Culture?
jobBuilder.workEnv.specialWorkCultureSub: Does your team care a lot about something else? Proud of the team’s record of getting results? Strong commitment to mental wellness? Actively involved in advancing diversity and inclusion? LGBTQ+ champions? Here’s a chance to let applicants know about the culture of the team they’ll potentially be joining.
jobBuilder.workEnv.stepDescription: Applicants care a lot about the team they’ll be working with and the physical workspace as well. Sharing information about these things help applicants determine if they’ll be a good fit, and can reduce the number of “wishful thinking” applications that slow down the screening process.
jobBuilder.workEnv.textAreaPlaceholder1: Try for a casual, frank, friendly tone.
jobBuilder.workEnv.title: Work Environment
jobBuilder.workEnvModal.title: Work Environment
jobDetails.cityLabel: Dans quelle ville l'équipe est-elle située?
jobDetails.classificationOptions.CR: CR - Commis aux écritures et aux règlements
jobDetails.classificationOptions.EC: EC - Économique et services de sciences sociales
jobDetails.flexHoursGroupBody: Vous voulez appuyer un milieu de travail plus inclusif sur le plan de l’égalité des sexes? Des études montrent que l’horaire flexible est un excellent moyen d’améliorer les possibilités des femmes et des parents.
jobDetails.flexHoursGroupHeader: À quelle fréquence les heures flexibles sont-elles permises?
jobDetails.heading: Détails sur l’emploi
jobDetails.modalBody: Here's a preview of the Job Information you just entered. Feel free to go back and edit things or move to the next step if you're happy with it.
jobDetails.modalHeader: You're off to a great start!
jobDetails.provinceLabel: Dans quelle province l'équipe est-elle située?
jobDetails.remoteWorkCanadaLabel: Oui, je suis prêt à superviser des employés partout dans le monde.
jobDetails.remoteWorkGroupBody: Vous voulez les meilleurs talents au Canada? Vous augmentez vos chances lorsque vous permettez à ceux qui se trouvent dans d’autres régions du Canada de présenter une demande. La diversité régionale ajoute également une perspective à la culture de votre équipe. Assurez-vous d’en discuter à l’avance avec votre conseiller en RH.
jobDetails.remoteWorkGroupHeader: Le travail à distance est-il permis?
jobDetails.remoteWorkNoneLabel: Non, j’exige que l’employé qui occupe ce poste soit dans le même lieu géographique que le bureau.
jobDetails.remoteWorkWorldLabel: Oui, je suis prêt à superviser des employés partout dans le monde.
jobDetails.securityLevelLabel: Quel est le niveau de sécurité?
jobDetails.securityLevelNullSelection: Veuillez sélectionner le niveau de sécurité...
jobDetails.teleworkGroupBody: Démontrez que vous faites confiance à vos employés et que vous avez une culture d’entreprise positive. Autorisez le télétravail en option.
jobDetails.teleworkGroupHeader: À quelle fréquence le télétravail est-il permis?
jobDetails.termLengthLabel: Quelle est la durée du poste (en mois)?
jobDetails.titleLabel: Quel est le titre du poste?
jobTasks.heading: Add Key Tasks
jobTasks.intro.first: What will your new team member spend their time on? What will they deliver?
jobTasks.intro.fourth: Once you have finished entering key tasks, you will move on to identify the individual skills needed to accomplish them.
jobTasks.intro.second: Focus on the key tasks. You don’t need to list every detail of the job, but applicants want to know how they will be spending most of their time.
jobTasks.intro.third: Aim to provide between four and six key tasks. (You can add as many key tasks as you want as you brainstorm here, but you can include no more than eight in the final job poster.)
jobTasks.modal.body: Here's a preview of the Tasks you just entered. Feel free to go back and edit things or move to the next step if you're happy with it.
jobTasks.modal.body.heading: Tasks
jobTasks.modal.title: Keep it up!
jobTasks.taskCount.error.body: You have exceeded the maximum number of key tasks allowed, but that’s okay. You can continue to add key tasks as you brainstorm here, but you will be asked to trim your list to 6 key tasks or fewer to proceed.
jobTasks.taskCount.error.title: Just a heads up!
jobTasks.taskCount.none: You don't have any tasks added yet!
jobTasks.taskCount.some: You have {taskCount,plural,,one{{taskCount, 2} task} other{{taskCount, 2} tasks}} added.
jobTasks.taskPlaceholder: Try for a casual, frank, friendly tone...
jobTasks.tasksMaximum: Please remove any additional tasks before continuing.
jobTasks.tasksRequired: At least one task is required.
ratingGuideAnswer.answerLabel: Acceptable Passing Answer / Required to demonstrate
ratingGuideAnswer.answerPlaceholder: Write the expected answer to pass the applicant on this skill...
ratingGuideBuilder.copyButton: Click to Copy This Ratings Guide to Your Clipboard
ratingGuideBuilder.copyInstructions: Now that you've built your Ratings Guide, you can use the button below to copy the entire thing to your clipboard, making it easy to paste in your favourite Word Processor.
ratingGuideBuilder.instructions: Below you will create your own ratings guide tool to help you assess your candidates. This tool allows you to build your own questions/evaluations for each assessment you've selected above, and then allows you to jot down the criteria for what a great candidate response might be. Please note that "Narrative Review" is unique in that the content is generated for you below.
ratingGuideBuilder.title: 3. Ratings Guide Builder
skillLevel.hard.advanced.description: You have the ability to accomplish tasks of significant complexity or impact with supervision.You provide advice and input on the approach to the tasks, and how they are delivered, for the supervisor’s consideration. You are able to advance the task, even in the face of moderate to large hurdles and complications. As you advance in this category, you should be developing the ability to accomplish tasks of significant complexity or larger impact with only light levels of supervision, where you are effectively the lead on the initiative. You may also take on a role of training others in this skills set or take on a light supervisory role for those at lower levels. This level is usually associated with tasks that form the bulk of the work for higher level positions, such as senior analysts or senior developers.
skillLevel.hard.advanced.name: Advanced
skillLevel.hard.basic.description: You have the ability to accomplish basic tasks with steady supervision and clear direction. The tasks you’re assigned are clear and don’t involve significant complexity. Their impact is usually locally felt. As you advance in this category, you should be developing the ability to accomplish tasks of moderate complexity with steady supervision. You will also need to be able to accomplish basic tasks with little or no supervision. This level is usually associated with tasks that form the bulk of the work for lower level positions, such as junior analysts or entry level developers.
skillLevel.hard.basic.name: Beginner
skillLevel.hard.expert.description: You have the ability to accomplish tasks of significant complexity or impact, where you call the shots and answer to the organization’s senior management for your decisions. You bring forward the tasks, the approach and the delivery plan for senior management consideration. You often supervise others (individuals or teams) in delivering tasks of high complexity or system wide impact. You are able to advance these tasks, even in the face of significant unforeseen hurdles and complications. As you advance in this category, you should be developing the ability to assess others at more junior levels, becoming able to clearly identify the difference between beginner, intermediate and advanced tasks. You should be able to build teams, set direction and provide supervision. This level is usually associated with tasks that form the bulk of the work for management and executive level positions.
skillLevel.hard.expert.name: Expert
skillLevel.hard.intermediate.description: You have the ability to accomplish tasks of moderate complexity or moderate impact with supervision.The approach to the tasks, and how they are delivered, is determined by the supervisor.You contribute input and advice.You are able to advance the task, even in the face of small to moderate hurdles and complications. As you advance in this category, you should be developing the ability to accomplish tasks of significant complexity or larger impact with steady supervision. You will also need to be able to accomplish tasks of moderate complexity or impact with little or no supervision. This level is usually associated with tasks that form the bulk of the work for mid-level positions, such as analysts or developers.
skillLevel.hard.intermediate.name: Intermediate
skillLevel.soft.advanced.description: You’re able to consistently demonstrate this skill or attribute in the workplace, including under conditions of high stress or difficulty. Your peers and supervisors recognize this as a strength you demonstrate in the workplace.
skillLevel.soft.advanced.name: Strongly in Evidence
skillLevel.soft.basic.description: You’re working on acquiring this skill or attribute. You are able to demonstrate it under favourable conditions (low stress, minimal difficulty) and can apply it in a work context intermittently.
skillLevel.soft.basic.name: In Early Development
skillLevel.soft.expert.description: This is a foundational part of who you are. You consistently demonstrate this skill or attribute, even under conditions of extreme stress or difficulty. Your peers and supervisors recognize this as a significant strength you demonstrate in the workplace, providing an example to others.
skillLevel.soft.expert.name: Deep Level Demonstration
skillLevel.soft.intermediate.description: You’re able to consistently demonstrate this skill or attribute in the workplace, including under conditions of low-to-moderate stress or difficulty. Your peers and supervisors are able to attest to the fact that you have been able to demonstrate this skill or attribute on a regular basis.
skillLevel.soft.intermediate.name: Moderately in Evidence
